cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Astral Above Elemental Below
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Model
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ash
planes.philosophicalEssence: The Plane of Ash highlights the commonality between air and fire—the tendency to movement and change, given a destructive tone by the raging conflagration of the plane.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Desolation and hostility; a refuge for outlaws and fugitives who shelter in floating ash clusters

physicalProperties.shape: A border region between the Elemental Plane of Air and the Elemental Plane of Fire, forming an endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: The plane is an endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash. Thick ash obscures sight and battering winds fill the atmosphere. Howling winds from the Plane of Air mix with the cinder storms and lava of the Sea of Fire.

temperature.description: Howling winds from the Plane of Air mix with the cinder storms and lava of the Sea of Fire, creating an environment of extreme heat from the fire element combined with searing hot winds.

physicalProperties.dominantElement: Ash (mixture of Air and Fire elements)
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash with howling winds and cinder storms. Battering winds make travel difficult.

timeFlow.description: No special time flow rules are specified for the Para-elemental Plane of Ash.

hazards.name: Thick Ash Obscurement
hazards.description: The thick ash obscures sight beyond a few dozen feet. The endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash severely limits visibility across the plane.

lightLevelModification.colorDescription: Dark gray and orange from flames, smoke, and ash

gravityModel.description: Ash clusters into floating realms; the plane exists as a border region between Air and Fire with no consistent ground surface.

hazards.name: Battering Winds
hazards.description: Howling winds from the Plane of Air mix with the cinder storms, creating battering winds that make travel difficult across the entire plane.

gravityModel.description: Winds batter travelers making movement across the plane difficult.

hazards.name: Endless Storm of Flames, Smoke, and Ash
hazards.description: The plane is an endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash. This is not a periodic weather event but a permanent condition of the entire plane, combining elements of fire and air into a destructive conflagration.

planarConnections.name: Sirocco Straits Connection
planarConnections.description: The Sirocco Straits is the region of the Plane of Air nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash, where hot, dry winds scour earth motes into barren chunks of rock.

planarConnections.name: Sea of Fire Connection
planarConnections.description: Lava flows through the Fountains of Creation toward the Para-elemental Plane of Ash and pools into the great Sea of Fire. The Sea of Fire's edge borders the Plane of Ash.

planarConnections.name: Ethereal Curtain to Plane of Ash
planarConnections.description: A dark gray ethereal curtain in the Deep Ethereal connects to the Border Ethereal overlapping the Para-elemental Plane of Ash. Distinguishable by color, texture, and temperature.

civilizations.name: Outlaw and Fugitive Shelters
civilizations.description: Here and there, ash clusters into floating realms where outlaws and fugitives take shelter.

adventureThemes: The commonality between air and fire—the tendency to movement and change given a destructive tone
Interaction and contrast between the forces and ideals embodied by air and fire
Extreme environments fundamentally similar to places found on the Material Plane
Exploring the destructive aspects of movement and change

crossReferences.description: Elemental Plane of Air section references Sirocco Straits as the region nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash
Elemental Plane of Fire section references lava flowing from the Fountains of Creation toward the Para-elemental Plane of Ash
Ethereal Plane section lists Para-elemental Plane of Ash as entry 9 on d12 Ethereal Curtains table with dark gray curtain color
Inner Planes section describes Para-elemental Planes as border regions between Elemental Planes where elemental substances overlap
Chapter 3 referenced for environmental effects related to heat hazards

planarTravelMethods.name: Ethereal Curtain to Para-elemental Plane of Ash
planarTravelMethods.description: Dark gray ethereal curtains in the Deep Ethereal lead to the Border Ethereal connected to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash. Curtains are distinguishable by color (dark gray), texture, and temperature.
requirements: Access to the Deep Ethereal via Plane Shift, Gate, or magical portal
risks: Ether cyclones in the Deep Ethereal
Travel time of 1d10 × 10 hours through the Deep Ethereal

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portal to Plane of Ash
planarTravelMethods.description: Portals and vortices can connect to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash. Vortices join an Elemental Plane with a very similar location on another plane.
requirements: Finding a portal that leads to the Plane of Ash
Meeting portal requirements (command, key item, random, situation, or time-based)
risks: Portal requirements may be difficult to meet

planarTravelMethods.name: Spell-based Travel to Plane of Ash
planarTravelMethods.description: Spells such as Gate and Plane Shift can transport adventurers to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash.
requirements: For Plane Shift, a tuning fork attuned to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash
risks: Arriving in the endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
